com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue

Interface YFSCheckOrderBeforeProcessingUE


  • public interface YFSCheckOrderBeforeProcessingUE

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkOrderBeforeProcessing(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The YFSCheckOrderBeforeProcessingUE user exit is called from scheduleOrder, releaseOrder and ChainedOrderCreate transactions.

    • Method Detail

      • checkOrderBeforeProcessing

        boolean checkOrderBeforeProcessing(YFSEnvironment env,
                                   org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                            throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

        The YFSCheckOrderBeforeProcessingUE user exit is called from scheduleOrder, releaseOrder and ChainedOrderCreate transactions. By default only orders that have a payment status of PAID, AUTHORIZED, INVOICED or NOT_APPLICABLE can be processed. This check will be skipped in scheduleOrder if the payment rule on the order does not require an authorization before scheduling. In addition to this, if rule 'Use pre 7.1 hold Functionality' is set, then held orders are not processed by default. If you are extending the system you can use this user exit to extend or override checks made on the order.

        The input xml contains details of the order that will be processed. The TransactionId of the transaction, calling the user exit, is also set in the Order element of the input xml. The user exit returns true, if the order is processed, and false, otherwise.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the methods in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.


        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD

        Pre-conditions: This user exit is called unconditionally.

        Post-conditions: The return parameter should be either true or false.


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.


        Returns:
        true if the order can be processed, otherwise false.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.
